subject: Re: Displaying the results of parameterized JUnit 4 tests in Eclipse

Hi,

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "James Abley" <james.abley@...> wrote:
>=
 That seems like a nice feature request. Are the test classes 
> annotated =
to run with the parameterized runner?

Yes, they are annotated as follows:
=
@RunWith(Parameterized.class)

As far as I know in JUnit 3 you could custom=
ize what to display in 
the JUnit view of Eclipse by overriding the getName=
() method of the 
TestCase. Is there any similar solution for that in JUnit=
 4?

>>  2.) Is there a way to display the Standard Output/Error 
>>  separ=
ately per each test run?
> 
> Can you explain a bit more about why you woul=
d want that?
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> James

When you run more then one JUnit test=
 cases (or a parameterized test) 
from Eclipse, by default you get only one=
 Console view where all 
the Standard Output/Error messages of all the exec=
uted tests are 
displayed in bulk.
I mean you cannot determine which messag=
e was output by which test 
case.

The problem is the same even if you exec=
ute your JUnit tests from Ant 
and generate a report. In the report you wil=
l have only 
the "System.out" and one "System.err" links for the entire tes=
t run 
and not one per each test case.

However, I would be interested in a=
 solution that captures 
the "System.out" of my "testMethod[1]" separately =
from 
the "System.out" of my "testMethod[2]".

Best regards,
Tibor
